Description: Blue glazed composition counterpoise-amulet: the top is in the form of a profile aegis of Sekhmet(?) with a sun-disc and black lappet-wig; beneath is a representation of Neheb-kau flanked by uraei; the roundel contains a representation of Harpocrates sitting on a lotus flanked by a winged uraeus and a ba-bird; on the back are a suspension ring and a rosette.
Curator's comments: Published: Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (Japan 1999-2000): No 83 Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt (1994): fig.40
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1986 Jun-Oct, Carmarthen Museum, A son of Luxor's Sands
